Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bcroyal
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend this hotel enough, very large room with enormous comfortable bed, nespresso machine, well equipped bathroom, free wifi etc etc. One strange thought whilst it had an ironing board the iron had to be collected from reception!! The hotel's location is great, as it's only a short walk from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Hotel Amstelzicht”
Reviews.Author: AnnAinRome
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Perfect location, welcoming sfaff, clean and newly refurbished rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Central location + great views!”
Reviews.Author: eshia01
Reviews.Content: Why did I give only 3 stars? It's based on the average of the two apartments we rented. We had a group of 8 people and we decided to rent the top 2 canal view apartments. The middle apartment (222) was fantastic: heaters work, full kitchen, has outside deck for smoking. The stairs are not for the faint of heart. They are steep! Try to negotiate those stairs after drinking or smoking, can be a challenge. The top apartment (223) had a weird layout. the slope of the roof prevented you from standing upright in the upstairs bedroom/bathroom for fear of bumping your head. The roof was so low, i had to sit on the bottom of the tub to take a shower. They do have a handheld shower head. The toilet is on the entering floor and the toilet seat smells horrible. i think mold or mildew has been eating away at the seat causing it to smell. I told the staff member when we left, so hopefully it has been switched out. The toilet sink also doesn't work, so you have wash your hands at the kitchen sink. The apartments are self maintained, so we ended up buying hand soap, paper towels, and cleaning spray. Luckily, someone left a sponge and dish soap. You would think that if they wanted you to keep the apartment tidy, they would leave cleaning supplies. The location was fantastic Easy to get to all parts of Amsterdam via trams or bus. To get here, take the 9 tram from Central Station, get off at Rembrantplein, head north toward Amstel Canal and its located at 104 Amstel. The receptionist, Evelyn was fantasic! She was always helpful, courteous, and great with restaurant suggestions. Overall, this was a nice hotel, just don't stay in apartment 223.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last februari and it was absolutly perfect. The welcoming by the recpetionist was great and she showed us all he interesting sights and helps us with booking tickets and reservation for restaurant. You can see that the hotel is just renovated, everything is brand new with modern furnishing. We stayed in de Canal Suite with a lot of extra like, bathrobes a Nespresoo machine etc, but the best part is the amazing view you have from this room. The breakfast is not inlcuded, but they offer you a very nice breakfast place called George Deli, you can have breakfast there with 20% discount and it is just around the corner! We would defenitly stay here again and we would recomend it to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - Lovely hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Aisling G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel - perfectly situated, Rembrandt square is just behind it and the tram is close by. It was not far to walk into the centre or to the train station. The building was secure and the staff accomodating. The building had these amazing steep steps, so do bear this in mind as hard to get cases down at the end but it all added to the charm. There were i-pop docking stations in the rooms and they were clean and well presented. There were also fridges and safes, I would definately stay there again - there was 12 of us in total and we had no complaints abotu anything!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: JDF_73
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Amstelzicht after the renovation. Really very beautifull room, with complete new furniture and very comfortable and all the facilities we needed. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The hotel is very well located, in the centre of Amsterdam near nice restaurants and bars. We will be back for our next stay in Amsterdam en we can recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently restored. It is in a very central and convenient position on the Amstel canal. The rooms are very clean and the service is wonderful. The guys at the reception are kind and always avalilable. I would stay at Amstelzicht again. Very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara T
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay in Amsterdam! Amazing combination of location, elegance, cleanliness of the room, spectacular view from the Double room with canal view, EXTREMELY helpful, friendly and nice stuff, Truly a wonderful experience, Will stay here each time when in Amsterdam, And no, they did not pay me for this review:) The only one minus - no room service. But actually, this is not a big deal because of many restaurants and bars nearby. Thanx, guys, You are my favorite place in Amsterdam! See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “They cheat your booking!”
Reviews.Author: Mogens A
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, so far so good, but don't believe their booking under any circumstances, because they are cheating and canceling bookings without any explanation. In my case i stayed during the IBC convention in september 2011 and payed with creditcard. After i came home i booked again for IBC 2012 as I know hotels are run out pretty soon and prices are increasing, no problem, i got a confirmation e-mail from booking.com and everything was fine - i believed... In January 2012 i got a e-mail from booking.com saying, that the credit card used for the booking wasn't valid and i had 24 hours to check it. I did, but after a day I got the message, that the booking was canceled because of the credit card. I checked with the card provider, no problems and no request for any authorization and they could see in their system, that i paid in September 2011 with the same card, so there was no problem at all. Well, i presented this for the hotel, but they were so arrogant and still claim, that there was a credit card error, witch i know and can prove, that there isn't !!! The real story is, that they wan't to increase the price during the IBC convention and get rid of early bookings with a lower acceptable price. That's why I want to warn you all out there about this hotel, they cheat, cancel and have no respect for their costumers, even them who have stayed by them before, so long story short, keep away from this gangsters!

Reviews.Title: “good viewpoint”
Reviews.Author: MM952
Reviews.Content: It's worth paying a little extra for a canal view to watch the world go by. Don't bother if you want a quiet night. The street is very busy- especially in the wee hours, but what do you expect next to Rembranstplein? Hotel staff -friendly & helpful, tended to defer more to my male friend despite the fact I'd made the booking. Facillities- just what you need. I disagree with all these negative reviews. If those reviewers want 5 star accomodation, they'll need to pay for it. Those stairs are steep - but it is Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Sakrison
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were on the second floor (thatâ€™s third floor in American), up a staircase that looked more like a ladder (no elevator). Our room was small by US standards but clean, quiet, and comfortable with a private bathroom (with shower), TV, free Wi-fi, and a small fridge. This is an older property and and it shows, but the owners plan a restoration in 2012 (no elevator planned.) The staff was friendly and helpful. (Our Lonely Planet guidebook was not much help.) The price was about average for Amsterdam--it's an expensive city to visit. Bottom line: we'd stay again--canal view next time.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the city centre”
Reviews.Author: peralk
Reviews.Content: I had their apartment room with a bedroom, an open kitchen and a livingroom. Very clean and spacious. A good place to stay if you want to explore Amsterdam. Just a few meters from Rembrandtplein, Trams or Subwway. Lots of bars, restaurants and fastfood stores just around the corner. But beware, This is an old building, Steep stairs with no elevator, and with noisy surroundings at night. If you canÂ´t cope with that, then choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unexpectedly fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: Penjehood
Reviews.Content: looking at the reviews regarding this hotel, me and my friends didnt expect anything good ... but when we got there we were surprised. The hotel is quirky, has very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel could do with some fresh paint on the walls and new carpets. Overall the hotel has real character, and the location is ideal, it is within walking distance to all the nice restaurants, attractions, shops, bars and coffeeshops. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - does not live up to the internet descripion”
Reviews.Author: HamburgChris
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of its internet presentation and the lavish praise in its guestbook - big mistake. The building may be historic but the rooms are dingy and totally overpriced. The promised "view" from our room was a view of the road. The owner was rude and aggressive. Our Australian visitors were shocked and disappointed. Amsterdam does itself no favours by having hotels like this.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect for our trip”
Reviews.Author: hmeyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Amstelzicht for 3 nights and it was all we needed. I'm not overly picky but I do like a decent place to stay and this hotel was just that. The bathroom was good, clean, good size, can't complain. The room itself was huge for European standards. The bed was actually pretty comfortable. The canal view room was awesome. If you're staying at this hotel I would recommend paying the extra little bit for a canal view. The check-in process was great. The receptionist was very efficient and helpful with any questions we had. The location is great - on the Amstel river, which is the largest canal in Amsterdam. It is right behind Rembrantdplein which has great restaurants and bars. A couple downsides, but did not bother us too much. It is pretty loud at night time because it is a main street and there are a couple bars right beside it and also the windows don't completely close. The carpets were a little dirty and was kind of a turn off. Other than that, this hotel was great for what we needed. I would recommend this hotel to young singles or couples that don't expect the best but want a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Amstel river lined with 1700's houses and dutch houseboats composed the wall to wall view.”
Reviews.Author: duskydon
Reviews.Content: This is an old building, 1689. The stairs are typical dutch (very steep) stairs and there is no elevator. The bathroom was well tiled and with good lighting. The hot water was hot. A wall to wall window sill over a radiator, and old wooden framed windows, from sill to ceiling, covered the north wall of this carpeted room. The wood framed window panes opened with old fashioned metal latches. You could sit on the sill or even lean out the window. The old fashioned extravagance of the 20 foot wide expanse of glass and wood made this room what it is. A desk, small table, and night stands for the queen bed finished the appointments. One block south is the tram. Many good restruants and even a coffeeshoppe are within a block. Best of all was the staff for this very small 12 room Hotel. I like old buildings, and was surprised not to have plumbing or electrical problems. With this staff I could have put up with even those sorts of things. My many questions were answered and some dutch customs explained. I was helped with maps, reservations, and their telephone calls helped me recover my lost debit card. They even helped me with my Nederlands though I must have seemed impossibly dense. Many times I asked the meaning of a word or phrase I heard or had said to me. They also told me when my Dutch was so strange sounding even they couldn't make out the word. I was directed to one of the best restruants and even given a map with very helpful directions. Traffic signs were carefully explained and how and where I could park my rented bicycle. I couldn't be more pleased with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite”
Reviews.Author: LFredz
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. We booked a quad room and didn't stay in the main hotel but in a horrible annex. Our room simply wasn't as described on line, it was freezing cold as the windows wouldn't close properly, we couldn't sleep at all because there was so much noise coming from a near by club and to make matters worse we were all covered in bed bug bites when we returned home.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU HATE STAIRS BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: jeffkelly561
Reviews.Content: Please note i know most of the hotels have stairs, but this is not for anybody who uses a wheelchair.The hotel is in the centre all you do is hope on the number 9 tram outside the train station and 10 mins later your there.Our room was the apartment which is down a very narrow flight of stairs.We went with 3 other couples there rooms were up a narrow flight of stairs.Our apartment was fantastic big bathroom,big double bed and a big living area with stove,fridge and tv.Your asking whats wrong there must be, well there was we had the dutch mickey mouse visit us.i told the manager and it was sorted fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: HazyBear
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic trip to Amsterdam, made all the better by this great place to stay! We booked a four person canal view apartment and after reading other reviews commenting on the noise from the bar below, requested a room on as high a floor as possible (Room 22). This was a good move, as from Thursday onwards, the street below was quite noisy. The apartment itself was wonderful. Large, well lit and well heated, with a fantastic view over the Amstel. Both the second and third floor apartments have small balcony's at the rear for the smokers among us. The sofa bed in the living area was large, if a little worn and firm, while the bedroom was comfortable, although the balcony doors had a slight gap.. Oh, The stairs are a bit steep, but not a problem for younger visitors

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous stay!!”
Reviews.Author: patty1611
Reviews.Content: I went with some friends for the weekend to Amsterdam and picked this hotel because it was so central located. It's a very old building ( from the 16th century) so alot of the things inside are historic wich is just beautiful. The staff was so friendly and helpfull and directed us to all the places Amsterdam had to offer. Love the location, great hotel and staff was amazing. We would definately come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mies88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September and we had a very good time here. The location is just perfect, all the famous sights are in walking distance. The receptionists Evelyn and Patricia were very helpfull with getting tickets for the Van Gogh museum and printing our boarding pass tickets, nothing was to much trouble. We stayed in the appartment and the stairs are really an adventure but the view is amazing!! There is a computer with free internet in the hotel and also wifi in the lobby, where you get a free cup of coffee in the morning. We would definitly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: lwx-delta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment of this small hotel for 3 nights. We paid more for the canal view it offers and as it turns out, the canal view from the apartment is excellent and the location is central and convenient. However, as it is located on a busy street and the century-old building is not well sound-proof, we had a hard time getting good sleep because the on-going traffic and rumbling trucks passing by as early as 4 am. As the hotel is old, things start to break down. We had no hot water for showers on the first night. By the time we found it out, we couldn't notify the night manager (we didn't have a cell phone and there is no phone inside the apartment). Besides, the hotel doesn't have 24-hour front desk and its front door is locked after 8pm. To be fare, the hotel staff is nice and prompt to resolve the hot water issue the following morning after I alerted the front desk receptionist. In short, the hotel is in a view and central location, the staff is professional and helpful, but be prepared for the traffic noises from the street and bar noise downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Chris & Julie Portland Victoria Australia”
Reviews.Author: jsamuel4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely place for 3 days, the staff on arrival were most welcoming and very warm, they had a great amount of local advice and knowledge, we found the rooms large, bright, airy and spotlessy cleanand we could not fault the bedlinen. The hotel is just 5 minutes from Rembrandt square which is very central to all transport with a good variety of eating places and cafes. We wold have no problems with recommending this hotel to anyone. The stairs are steep but this adds to the charm, just loved it

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: JaneLittle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in the canal room. An additional bed was added for our son. It was a lovely room with a wonderful view. The people were very helpful and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “You can find a much better hotel in the best western for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Rocky1998
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. The bar at the bottom of the hotel is extremly loud and has smoke come up to the rooms above. The windows don't seal so you don't have any noise sealing from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Very very very very nice!”
Reviews.Author: janBarcalona
Reviews.Content: After 3 nights at there sister Hotel ROBERTRAMON we moved to Amstelzicht, as the Hotel was fully booked. Arrived at Amstelzicht we where very happy, what a historical building, the hallway and stairway is amazing. I believe the building is 400 years old. The welcome was friendly and warm. Our room was on the back of the hotel, unfortunaly no view to the canal, but we didnt reserve a room with a view so no problem. The room had TV, minibar, safe, bathroom, telephone. The room and bathroom where clean. Downstairs was an internet computer for free, as well i saw guest using there computers in the lobby. The location is in the middle of the centre, everything was just around the corner, very easy. By check out the reception called a taxi and walked with us to the street, the staff was realy friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great position,dirty filthy pig sty,with the MOST unhelpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: BristolHappycamper
Reviews.Content: We had a very bad experience, our first room was in the basement, which was disgusting, the bathroom had mould all over the walls.On the first night we were flooded with raw sewage, ah well these things happen. Surely the management would move us to a new room. No vacant rooms,"it will all be alright soon", this was half past midnight and the plumber was there clearing the drain with a pump,the stench was unbelievable and the ridiculous manager was telling us it would all be "OK" After much confrontation he agreed to call his sister hotel to get us a room,he got us a room and a taxi but said we would have to make our own way back in the morning. He was really pushing his luck! We left Amstelshite,as it is now affectionately called, at 1.30 am like refugees with carrier bags with our nightware and washbags,on the understanding that the Clown was paying for a taxi to and from the hotel and for the night in the sister hotel,which by the way was lovely but very far out,and we wouldn't be charged for the ruined night in Amstelshite. Did I mention we had paid upfront, big mistake! Next day Clown was unavailable for comment and Helga the hard faced receptionist was saying we were not only,not getting our money back for the ruined night but we were to be charged for the night in the sister hotel. It was like be in a episode of candied camera. Needless to say we were moved from the original room to room 2, in reception. We got no money back and no satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant base for a leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: centcg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about a 15-20 min walk away from the centraal station which is a bit of a walk however the hotel is still centrally located being within a couple of minutes walk of a number of coffeeshops and restaurants so you don't have to go far for something to do in the evening. We stayed in the 2nd apartment (middle one) which is a couple of yards from the entrance of the hotel so this isn't based on the rooms in the hotel, however the apartment we stayed in was pretty much perfect. There was plenty room for 4 people (double bed and double sofa bed), dining table for 4, a reasonable balcony, full bathroom complete with washing machine aswell as a kitchen with dishwasher and full utensils for 4. Everything was clean and looked new-ish so there was no complaints on the room front. Check in was painless with friendly front desk staff although this was the only contact we had with reception as you get your own key and front door. Although this hotel was perfect for 4 lads on a smoking trip, the apartment and location would be brilliant for any kind of trip whether its a couple or a family. Lastly, the only small downside was possibly the location, even though the hotel has beautiful views over the canal and isn't that far away from anywhere, you'll still be walking around quite a bit. Don't let you put this off though as you get to see more of the city by walking. Overall it was well worth it (â‚¬218 for 2 nights total) and I'll definately be returning with either my friends or girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: TRAVLDAWG
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Amstelzicht after having a 3 week adventures trip in Morocco. We stayed on the top floor with the view of the Amstel river. So worth it. The view was everything to us . The two blond girls and dutch -moroccon girl that we met at the front desk were great.,very friendly , professhonel and sweet as could be. Its also in the area of the Rembrandsplein with all it resturants and pubs

Reviews.Title: “Shared our room with another hotel guest... A mouse!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexis M
Reviews.Content: We travelled in a group of 10 people and had 3 different rooms. I can easily say our room was by far the worst. Our room was at the back of the hotel and faced onto another hotel, in the morning bottle bins where emptied and staff from the other hotel / restuaruant would stand out back smoking and chatting so it was difficult to have a lie in. The carpet had ominous looking discoloured and hard patches on it that made us slightly worried as to what had gone on before we got there. The sheets and bathroom was clean although the towels where very thin and felt rather old. The soap in the bathroom was found in 2 dispensers attached to the wall, one at the sink and one in the shower - I was very wary of using this as i couldnt actually see what was in it!! The fridge that was in our room smelt very mouldy and didnt work. On the third night of our stay we discovered a lovely little mouse scurrying around our room. As we managed to trap the mouse in a bin and had other people to stay with that night we didnt class this as an "emergency" and therefore didnt call the emergency number in the welcome book. The next day we advised reception about the mouse and said we felt we shouldnt pay for the room for that night. They offered us 25% off 1 nights stay and after about 30 mins of arguing over the phone with the manager he eventually agreed to "generously" give us 50% off that night. He advised that as we didnt remove our things from the room and he couldnt let it to another guest he would be unable to refund 100% of that night. Kind of worries me that he would let the room with the mouse in it to another guest???? I can say that i would not stay here again although the staff where reasonably friendly i felt it quite expensive for what we where getting although to be fair i do not know the average rates for a hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “SLEEP TIGHT DON'T LET THE BEDBUGS BITE”
Reviews.Author: Denisen13
Reviews.Content: The best things about this hotel are the very friendly and helpful staff and the great location but that's as far the good things go. We booked a quad room for a long weekend in early October and although we knew that we wouldn't be staying in the main hotel and that there was a noisy club nearby, we didn't realise that we would be staying in such a bizarre set-up. And we really weren't prepared to arrive home and find bites appearing all over our bodies.

Reviews.Title: “Large and Clean rooms, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Jan69Brussel
Reviews.Content: The rooms was realy large and clean, 3 windows overlooking the canal. Room was cleaned everyday. The room and service felt like staying in someones home. The room had a minibar, telephone, TV, radio, Coffee and tea making facilties, I loved the curtains, after closing it became realy dark, we could sleep long in the morning. The stairway was very stief but nice original. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year!”
Reviews.Author: carlosSalamanca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Amstelzicht for 5 nights, to celebrate new year. We reserved a canal view apartment. We were doubting after reading some reviews but we have to say we were very happy. We checked in at apartment number 22, the reception told us the apartment was just renovated and we loved it, the stairway was very small and narrow , but we know that from there website, so no problem. The apartment was very large and the view, wow amazing, Amsterdam as it was in my dreams!! Everything was new, the kitchen had a dishwasher, magnetron, and large refrigerator. We also had a large balcony. Everything was very clean and daily the staff checked if we need anything. On the 31 th December there was a bottle of Champagne in our room. By check out we could leave our luggage at the reception. A good place at a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of gave me the creeps”
Reviews.Author: Bauers76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a really great area, close to the trams and some good restaurants. The view from the front is of the Amstel canal and was really beautiful. I found the reception people helpful and pleasant. The room was kind of creepy. I was a little scared to sleep in the bed (I've heard bad stories of bed bugs) this one did not have any, thankfully, but the bed was terribily uncomfortable. My husband descrided his pillow as a block of wood (I scouted out the pillows first and made sure I got the better ones!). The room was big but needed some new wall paper and carpet. The bathroom was ok. The hotel is located right next to a gay bar which doesn't close till 4 am. Luckily we were there on a Monday and Tuesday night, so the noise was not so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room over gay bar”
Reviews.Author: cogarch
Reviews.Content: This was a real disappointment. The staff were friendly and I found the ultra-steep stairs a curiosity rather than a hindrance. However the room, which was supposedly one of the best, on the first floor with a lovely view of the Amstel, also overlooked a deceptively small but noisy road while the proximity of an even noisier gay bar on the ground floor meant that I was kept awake until 2.00 am at the weekend, and could not leave the window open. The promised WiFi also did not extend into my room -- I was reduced to wardriving a nearby unsecured network instead. There was no breakfast available. The washbasin tap was loose and requests to refill the soap dispenser (inconveniently provided instead of actual soap) went ignored. The bedsheets smelled stale and I suspect were infested with housemites.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like this hotel ... honest ...”
Reviews.Author: Waterloon
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay for 2 nights in central Amsterdam -- my wife and I + 2 kids (10 and 12). So we needed a proper family room. The Amstelzicht had just enough positive reviews and a rate just on the verge of affordability (170) that we gave it a shot. The positive: good location near Rembrandt plaza. Close to many good things, not too seedy. The main building looks quite nice. Quaint with just enough nice touches. Our room was 2 separate rooms with lots of space, a small kitchenette, and 2 TV's. Perfect for a family. It was clean enough though a fresh coat of paint would have been nice. Towels and sheets were OK. The negative: the family rooms are all in the "Annex" building. You access it via a lockable gate leading to a private alley. The windows face out into the alley so no possibility of a view. Though the alley was clean with no bad smells, on our way to the check out there was major broken glass from a broken beer bottle. I have no problems with less-than-perfect places but that alley with the awful view is just creepy IMHO. I'm sure that if we were a regular couple in the main building, it would be great but for 170 Euros? Unfortunately, when you're trying to find online, 4 beds in a single room in peak-season Amsterdam your choices are greatly reduced. Perhaps 4 young travellers splitting the cost would find this place perfect ... unfortunately, that wasn't us.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel...sheets surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: motilidik
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness of rooms is not the best. At our arrive we found the sheets dirty (several stain like a squirt...) but they provide quickly to change it whit a little shame. Room number 2 is just over the reception and the huge window overlook a backyard with service entrance of a restaurant. You can see trash can and refrigerator engine. Everyone can see you when you are in the room to changing and showering. A lot of noise due to waitress hustle and bustle and smoking break. I used earplugs to sleep. The bathroom is clean and wide. A lot of hot water and clean towel everyday. A budget hotel, in a lovely position (everything is near, just a short walking) for group of friends unpretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jel79
Reviews.Content: We only spent a night in Amsterdam, and this hotel provided a great base for us to explore the city on foot easily. We were close to all amenities including, restaurants, pubs, supermarkets, internet cafes and the fantastic flower markets. We arrived early in the morning at the hotel and were able to check in and leave our luggage (although we were not able to go up to our room until later that afternoon). This allowed us to enjoy our limited time and get exploring! We were a bit disappointed to be placed in a room on the top floor as we travelled with our 1 year old daughter, her travel cot, pram and our suitcases and we did request something quiet, and easy to access. 3 very tiny tiny and steep flights of stairs later we arrived at our room. Large (apparently rare in Amsterdam), clean and quiet. No views, but all the amenities we needed - tv, fridge, phone, double bed and space!

Reviews.Title: “great views, fantastic location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: HelloFromOregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and found everything wonderful. Our room was huge by european standards. The view was amazing. The furnishings were very nice. I have paid a lot more money to stay in horrible rooms in amsterdam, so we are very happy to have found this hotel; we will return

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amber75
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading some good reviews on trip advisor. 3 girls shared a triple room at the Amstelzicht for 2 nights. The reception staff were excellent very friendly, smartly dressed and even helped carry our cases. The room was a good size and the shower was awsome, hot and powerful. Would recommend without a doubt. Not the most central location though. Thanks for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: tripsterDonegal
Reviews.Content: stayed in apartment beside hotel.clean and comfortable.mini kitchen with 2 ring cooker but no cutlery or dishes!otherwise we enjoyed our stay..staff very helpful but beware of prices in minibar.plenty of cafes for breakfast and dinner nearby.tram stop 1 min walk.canal bus stop 2 mins away

Reviews.Title: “Satified but not impress”
Reviews.Author: annieh30
Reviews.Content: The first thing we have to talk about is the STAIRS!!!! Please beleive all the coments you see on this site because it is true: the stairs as so steep you would think they would be better to call it a lader... it is really unbelivable!!! You lieraly have to keep yourself steady with the next stair... The rooms are clean even if everithing in it is positively old: the carpets, the walls, the drapes, everithing...and not in a historical way just in a old and crummy way. If you choose to have a canal view you will be really satisfied because the view is REALLY amazing. The hotel is in a good spot in the middle of everithing and near the tram station: the trams are the better way to go see everything. Amsterdam is a marvelous city and dont miss to see 2 really important things: the Van Goh museum and the Ann Frank museum... If I have the great chance one day go back to Amsterdam I would not go back to that hotel but it is not that bad... for the price i WOULD SAY YOU CAN DO BETTER.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: krislecl
Reviews.Content: It was so hard to find a relatively deceant priced hotel in Amsterdam. We were lucky to stumble upon this one. The location of this hotel is great. It's walking distance to everything, though everything in Amsterdam is close. It's right behind Rembrandt Square and just a short walk to Dam Square, RLD and the central shopping area. Our room was a canal view double and it was enormous! The windows stretched across the whole length of the wall and the view was beautiful. The room was very clean, the bathroom very small but was perfect for us considering the only time spent in our room was for sleep and showering. The bed wasn't too great. There was a really bad smell in the room. Even though it was a non smoking room the stench was awful. Our clothes reeked when we came home and opened our suitcases. Besides that it was perfect. The front desk staff was very nice and very helpful. For the price we paid, it was great. Would probabaly try somewhere else next time but would still recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “not a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: opel03
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from 17th-19th of September. Good and bad points to this hotel. Good points : Staff are lovely. Location is brilliant, 10 mins walk to dam square. Bad points : Very steep stairs. No breakfast included. Stayed in room 10, carpet was filty. Cost us 300 euro for twin room for two nights. For what we got found this expensive.

Reviews.Title: “There were mice in the apartments”
Reviews.Author: GGZ
Reviews.Content: We were in an apartment and it was quite dirty. The floor, the sofa..., not very nice. Windows were old and it is just over a pub, so it is quite difficult to sleep before 4am. But the big problem, and reason why we left the hotel, was that the second night we found a mouse in our aparment! not very nice to live with them. The worst of all, was that when we called to the manager (reception is closed after 22h), they did not offer any solution until the following morning. Hotel manager told us you can find mice in there because it is an old building and it is by the canal, so... we just got our money back and left the site.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms, helpful staff, but...”
Reviews.Author: Venga
Reviews.Content: The triple room (room number 14) was in the ground floor of the main building and had both good and negative features. The decoration was nice and the room was clean. However, what was not mentioned anywhere was the not so nice view to the backyard and trashcans. The same backyard was used by a restaurant from the opposite building and the staff had their cigarrette breaks behind our window so we had to keep the drapes closed all the time to avoid feeling like animals in the zoo. Also, they were emptying the trashcans and pouring empty bottles (a lot of them...) from one trashcan to another, which made a lot of noise. According to the hotel staff this never happens before 10 am but during our stay the noise started after 8 am already. So forget about sleeping late in the morning (at least in room 14), it is impossible. Most of the hotel staff was very helpful, first our room was freezing and when we mentioned this, they brought us an extra heater within 5 minutes. Also most of the lampbulbs were broken and it was rather dark in our room (also because we had to keep the drapes closed pretty much all the time), they fixed the bulbs too right after we told them. The quad rooms where in another buildning and they were ok. Definitively better beds and pillows than in the triple room. Free internet. The only little "problem" with this was an elderly lady who occupied the computer for a whole day to herself.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with really serious problems”
Reviews.Author: MatthewM
Reviews.Content: The Staff: (4/5) - friendly and helpful people The Location: (2/5) - One the bright side, Amstelzicht is is good proximity to much that is interesting in Amsterdam. It is an eight minute walk east of the Bloemenmarkt. The location is severely hampered by the combination of a very busy road (Amstel) and a great deal of loud foot traffic by noisy drunks. Both the traffic noise and the louts can last into the wee hours. The Room: (4/5) - featured excellent old wooden furniture. It was unusually spacious. A tiny refrigerator not intended for your actual use (holds the 3 euro soda). Had a decent bathroom with stand-up shower and average water pressure. The window blinds were dark enough to allow a good sleep-in (valuable if the drunks keep you awake until 3am) The Bed (2/5) - for a hotel of this cost, one might expect at least an average bed. The mattress was unworthy of a shabby college dormitory. The frame was pretty, but I'd have preferred some straw in a stable. The Hotel (2/5) - the pleasant interior of the hotel is nice to look at. But the hard floors and walls of the hallways are DREADFULLY loud when other guests are walking to their rooms. As it is, you'll hear every step and comment (BLAH! BLAH! BLAH! CLACK! CLACK! CLACK!!!...) of every guest as they chat merrily to their rooms after dinner. The Amenities (2/5) - no food available except the overpriced snacks in the minifridge. But many small and decent restaurants are nearby. The 'free wifi' provided to the hotel is basically non-existent. When the signal appeared it was non-functional. Until the Hotel shells out a little money for sound-deadening hallway features (like carpet and thicker doors and windows), the Hotel Amstelzicht should be avoided. At a minimum, insist on exploring your room before check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, great location & room, friendly staff, but ........”
Reviews.Author: WarwickSuzie
Reviews.Content: Being our third stay in Amsterdam my husband and I wanted to stay in a hotel that was centrally located for us to walk everywhere for our long weekend. It had to be reasonably priced and better than average accommodation. And Hotel Amstelzicht did not disappoint. We booked on-line one evening. There was a problem with our card, and the next day one of the members of staff called and left a friendly answer phone message, even wished us Happy New Year! A personal touch that put us at ease on what reception awaited us on our arrival. We arrived on a Thursday evening, and the welcome was great. We dumped our bags and headed straight out for a bite as it was getting late. Foolishly we went to one of the first restaurants we came to. We advise that you don't go there! Can't remember what it was called but it's an Italian restaurant. Staff were miserable, only happy when you pay, and the food was soooo salty! We recommend Casa de David a fab Italian restaurant, 5 mins walk. We then headed back to the hotel, and this is where the BUT..... comes in. We stayed in Room 1, which is a massive canal view room, on the ground floor, next to the front door. We thought the traffic of people coming in & out of the hotel would be noisy, but that wasn't a problem, it was the noise of the goings on outside. Cars, scooters, and an Irish pub a few doors down and at kick out time it got very loud with drunk people loitering, and when they go the bar staff empty all their glass bottles into a bin, which seems to be right by the bedroom window! (We also found that the lighting was very dim in the room) Needless to say we didn't get much sleep, thankfully I had brought earplugs, but they didn't help a great deal. First thing my husband went to reception to ask for another room, as we were staying there for another 3 nights, and they were more than accommodating. We had the choice of three rooms, all of which we were able to view. Two of them were canal view rooms, one on the 2nd floor, can't remember the room number, looked lovely, and so did the one on the top floor, room 12 I think. But in the end we chose room 11, which was also on the top floor but at the rear of the hotel. They refunded us the difference for moving to the rear of the hotel, and even carried our bags up to our room, which we were so glad about as the stairs are steep, and they seem endless when you've just come back at the end of the day from probably walked about 6 miles. The room was so much quieter, better furnished and nice to have a window in the bathroom. There was only one niggle that we found with the room, which was the toilet leaked a bit when it was flushed. We saw three different members of staff on reception during our stay, and all of them were lovely, friendly and very professional. They were always interested in what we had planned for the day and gave great advice, and always remembered the next day to ask about how we got on. We would definitely stay again, and have already recommended Hotel Amstelzicht to friends. But remember to try and avoid a canal view room, as if you plan to be out all day the curtains will be closed 90% of the time of your stay, and bear in mind that the stairs are steep and narrow, more so the higher you go.

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous and rude!”
Reviews.Author: Beveraldo
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival early on a Saturday evening our party of 2 couples requiring 2 rooms was told that due to an error made only the day before there was only 1 room available. Having booked months in advance we were disappointed to say the least to find they had double booked. We are told that the website we booked through had contributed to this mistake and we will be contacting them to complain. This double booking error was compounded by the attitude of the duty manager who called us 'unreasonable' and 'difficult' for making the justifiable request that the hotel arrange for us to have accomodation elsewhere for the full 3 nights of our stay. The best we were offered after much indignation on our part and plenty of uncomfortable incompetence from the duty manager was 2 nights at a hotel that was '2 mins away' for 2 nights and returning for a complementary final night at Amstelzicht. This may sound good but the arguments it took to get to this stage left a very sour taste. So we went off to our other hotel having agreed to pay the rate we would have done at Amstelzicht at what turned out to be a very nice and friendly hotel. The '2 mins away' turned out to be a half an hour walk in the pouring rain which was obviously not a great start to our Saturday night! We probably lost a good couple of hours of what should have been fun time in Amsterdam! So the saga continued upon arrival at the alternative hotel when they asked for poayment for the 2 nights stay at a more expensive rate that we had agreed to pay at Amstelzicht. They were well within their rights to do so but having been advised by Amstelzicht that this would not be the case we were miffed! The higher price was reflective of the standard of hotel it is important to say, it was lovely. We were not looking forward to going back to Amstelzicht for our final night but luckily we did not see the same member of staff who had been so rude to us and in fairness to the other people there they were courteous. Having been in fairly plush surroundings for 2 nights it was a shame to have to endure the grubby feeling and cold (however large suites) at the Amstelzicht. We certainly won't be rushing back here!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ginkoOopNorth
Reviews.Content: Booked on the strength of other online reviews - not disappointed. Superb location, walking distance to city centre and easy tram links to the rest of Amsterdam and the train station (24/48 hour tram card recommended) close to Rembrandt Plein, so easy to find. Booked 2 rooms - a triple - large, but dark - and a double Amstel canal view room which was lovely, bright, huge windows, nice furnishings. Bedspread a little distressed, but sheets crisp and clean- bed large and on the soft side, but comfy. Bathroom good. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Leaving luggage before check-in and after check-out not a problem. No breakfast facilities, but loads of cafe opions nearby. If you stay here DO NOT MISS a visit to the Tuschinski cinema off Rembrandtplein - if you like Art Deco it is quite simply a jaw dropper. Drop in for coffee in the sumptuous foyer. The main hall is incredible, we were not stopped from having an explore - there's no where else like it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel apartment for 4”
Reviews.Author: bennybex
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel apt for 4 as we were travelling with 2 children ages 11 and 8. The hotel itself is next to the Amstel canal, and the apts are just down the street down a side alley. The location couldnt be beaten, and we had a fantastic time. However, I would definately not recommend the apt for 4 people. There is one small living room with 2 arm chairs and a table with 2 chairs. The bedroom has two single beds pushed together, and a seperate single bed pushed in the corner. There was also a tiny camp bed left in the middle of the sitting room to accomodate our youngest! As he was to afraid to sleep in a room on his own, we had all 4 beds crammed into the one bedroom and all had to clamber across each other during the night for the inevitable toilet trips! The apt was fine for 3 people, 3 if you dont mind sharing a bedroom. We have stayed in better and worse places, and basically just see our room as a place to crash, however if you have highter expectations, dont rent the apt!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: nuttyrice
Reviews.Content: My summer stay in Amsterdam at the Hotel Amstelzicht was delightful! I had a charming room that faced the Amstel Canal where I had a lovely view of boats travelling by and incredible architect of buildings across the canal. The hotel was conveniently situated within walking distance to all my favorite spots, cafes, shops, museums and galleries. The tram from Central Station drops you off literally steps away from the hotel. I was very impressed with the friendly english speaking staff. The owners Robert and Ramon were especially friendly and accomodating with ample suggestions from where to eat and what to see. As an avid traveller, I've never stayed at a place where I felt the owners of the hotel would mingle with their guests and make sure you were happy and comfortable. With that kind of service I would opt to stay at Hotel Amstelzicht everytime I come to Amsterdam. The rooms are neat, clean, spacious and had a touch of coziness with flowers. You can always spend a load of money and stay at one of the snooty fancy hotels, but my choice would be to stay somewhere cozy, friendly, clean and safe. This sweet, quaint little hotel is my choice. Thanks for the good memories Robert and Ramon and making me feel very welcome! Tot ziens!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: D4SUL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel for 3 nights (17-19 September) and I have given our overall experience an "above average" rating mainly because of the fantastic location of the hotel. We arrived at 11.20 pm at night, having emailed the hotel the day before to warn them of our late arrival. I cannot fault the Reception staff that were on duty during our stay, they were polite, friendly and helpful at all times. We negotiated the VERY steep and narrow stairs (I only take a size 5 ladies shoe and my full foot would not fit onto one of the stairs) up to our first floor room overlooking the canal at the front of the hotel (my husband had paid extra for this view). What we didn't appreciate when we booked a room with a view is that inbetwen the hotel and the canal is an extremely busy road (day and night). If peace and quiet is what you are after then do not book a room at the front of the hotel. The room in itself was large with high ceilings, but it did have a touch of shabbiness about it and the lighting in the room was so poor that it was hard to see at night. The following morning clarified what I thought, wallpaper peeling in the corner, threadbare bedspread and worn carpet. We paid â‚¬465 for 3 nights. The hotel is in need of some tlc but as mentioned before is in the right spot for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: sally-wales
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would recommend it! Its a two minute walk from shops, the flower market and other tourist places in Amsterdam. Inside is very clean, and the staff are friendly and speak very good English. The hotel was built sometime in the 17th century and you can still see some original features; this includes the staircases which are very steep, if you have difficulties with stairs then i would ask for a ground floor room when you book! I was staying on the third floor but the stay was worth the hike! If i was visiting Amsterdam for a second time i would definately stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nic eHotel. Well located”
Reviews.Author: blueTaurus
Reviews.Content: Really nice place. Good location. Staff were very friedly and helpful. We had a huge room with a view of the canal. Breakfst was good. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May with friends. We booked two double rooms, one canal view and one normal. The canal view room was lovely, spacious and the view was fantastic. The standard double didn't have the view but it was very comfortable and spacious and all you could ask for. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful, they booked excursions and helped us with directions around the city and were always happy to do so. The location was ideal, very close to everything you would want to see with a number of restaurants and cafe's within 5 mins walk of the front door. I did alot of research on cheaper hotels and it really paid off this time, you couldn't fault anything and we will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: ctheworld88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Amstelzicht April 10-12, 2006 after a week in London. We flew to Amsterdam from Heathrow and walked the 15 minutes to our hotel from Central Station. We arrived at 2PM and our triple room was ready. Our room was situated at the back of the hotel next to the reception desk (cannot recall the room number). However, this was preferential because there were only 4 stairs to get into the room. As the previous reviews have mentioned, the hotel stairs are very steep. This is worth mentioning because if you are considering this hotel, and cannot climb stairs, ask for this room. The room was very clean, but well-worn (as are most small European hotels), and the queen bed and pillows were comfortable. Note, however, that if you request a triple, the cot provided is very soggy and uncomfortable. There is a refrigerator in the room, but it is only to house the mini-bar contents. They ask that you do not put your own items in it. The view was not the best as it faced the rear of the building, but we did not spend that much time in our room. It was sufficient to let in some natural light and to check on the weather before going out. The hotel does not provide breakfast, but it does offer free coffee and tea during the morning for guests. Robert was very helpful providing change for taxis, restaurant recommendations and directions to various sights. The staff was always helpful and ready with a smile. The location of the hotel could not have been better. It sits facing the Amstel, and it is literally around the corner from the Rembrandtplein which has many restaurants and outdoor cafes. It is also in an ideal location from which to sightsee and explore. After some research and comparison, we booked directly through the hotel via the Internet and received a rate of about 200 Euro per night for a triple. We felt this was a good value for the price considering the location. Overall, we would recommend this hotel and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the apartment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we had a lovely apartment in the roof of the building which got lots of light and sunshine and was relatively quiet, considering its location in the HEART of Amsterdam. The servuce was outstanding and the people, both at the hotel and in the city, went out of their way to help.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid apartments like the plague”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading several positive reviews of the Hotel Amstelzicht, I was looking forward to the stay in Amsterdam. Unfortunately how wrong!!!!! I had booked an apartment.....it was cold and dirty and backed onto a dark alleyway. When I approached the manager/owner he suggested that My partner and I wore warmer cloths even though at the time (because it was clold) we were wearing our jackets.We also ended up sleeping in them as well.The club next door kept us awake through to the very early hours of the morning. The Manager/owner was extremely rude and unhelpful.Thank goodness we were there only three days.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ottawagal80
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop of our honeymoon, and we very much enjoyed our stay at Amstelzicht. The staff were very welcoming and friendly, and we found the room to be satisfactory and clean. This is by no means a luxury hotel, but if you are looking for clean accomodations that present good value in Amsterdam, I highly recommend this hotel. The stairs are difficult to negotiate, so I would not recommend the hotel to those with physical disabilities. Otherwise though, we had a fabulous time, and there is a great restaurant just around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service And Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, great rooms and great service!!! What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “My best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before arriving in Amsterdam, I have heard some terrible stories about Amsterdam hotels. However, I found Amstelzicht Hotel to be very welcoming and the staff were so friendly and accommodating.Their hospitallity is the greatest I have experience yet. The location of the hotel is excellent,very close to cafes, restaurants,shoppping malls and museums.Above all it is a very safe area to relax and walk around even at night.our room was absolutely huge (we got a triple room instead of a double). Although the bathroom was small but it was clean and manageable.I would like to thank the lovely staff at Hotel Amstelzicht for their fantastic service. Coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service and friendly staff before. The appartment was great, it was clean, warm en there were beautifull flowers and fruit on te table. The appartment is also very suitable for little children. The bed was very comfortable en the bathroom luxury. The hotel is located perfectly, you can easily walk to the most beautifull places of Amsterdam. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spacious apartment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an apartment of Amstelzicht, which was beautiful and quite spacious, especially for Amsterdam. The whole hotel was very nice decorated and very comfortable. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. This place is a fantastic value. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Amstelzicht. The staff was very helpful, by check in they gave us all the information we needed. Everything was very close to the hotel. The room smelt fresh and was very clean. A nice large bed and good shower. We liked the fact that we realy felt home, afer a day of walking we were able to relax in our comfortable room. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed this time”
Reviews.Author: jeffcavalier
Reviews.Content: second time here our first time really good nice and quit and friendly atmosphere !!! whats gone wrong this time room poor inadaquate facilities , building site otside , unfriendly at reception and dont ask to take coffee from reception to your room THIS IS NOT ALLOWED sorry but will not be returning

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Amsterdam was made even better by this great hotel. Since we arrived at the hotel we have been treated very nicely by the staff. We arrived around 9.00 am at the hotel. The reception clerk probably noticed that we were very tired from an overnight flight and he offered us a nice cup of coffee before checking in. Later we discovered that free coffee is offered every morning! We were able to leave the luggage until we could check in to our room. By the way the staff was very helpful with carrying the luggage to our room, which was at the top floor. The room has all facilities we needed, was nicely decorated and it has a splendid view on the Amstel Canal. One day it was raining the whole day, fortunately the hotel offered big golf umbrellas! Resuming, a nice hotel with reasonable prices in the center of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location is key! I travel to Amsterdam 3 times a year and stay at this lovely, quaint, reasonably priced hotel on the canal overlooking the Amstel. Conveniently located, right smack dab in the middle of anywhere you'd want to be- but far enough away from the noisy streets. Be prepared to take a tram from the Centraal Station to their hotel it's a quick and easy 7 minute ride on the tram, just ask the guys when you book the hotel which tram number to take (1.60 euro for the tram vs. 20.00 euro if you take a cab- major rip off). The flower market, the shopping districts, great restaurants and beautiful sites are all in walking distance. I usually stay in one of their apartment style rooms- they vary in decor. Always greeted with fresh flowers and equipped with all amenities and a rather large bathroom (not standard for Euro hotels). If you are traveling during the winter months, don't worry about heating. It's quite cozy and comfortably warm in the rooms that I've stayed in. The english speaking staff is friendly and the owners, Robert and Ramon are wonderful hosts making sure your stay is pleasant! I can't wait for my next trip out. I don't ever have to think of where to book a room. When I go to Amsterdam I know to book Hotel Amstelzicht!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed out stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from staying at the Hotel Amstelzicht and we have a lovely time. It's near everything (I suppose everything in Amsterdam is near!!) so it's really handy. The staff couldn't be nicer. Big Hellos when we came in every day and 'Have a Lovely Day's when we were leaving every morning. I would recommend this place to people who want a base in Amsterdam as there's no dining facilities here, but not to people with any kind of walking difficulties. The stairs are quite steep!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing apartment”
Reviews.Author: 218rosemary
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a top floor canal view apartment which far exceded our expectations. The apartment was very spacious, comfortable and clean and it had every facility you could want. The hotel staff were very helpful and we really couldn't fault the place or the staff. The hotels location is fantastic and the views from the apartment were really really amazing! Highly recommended for a comfortable and stylish Amsterdam break. Mary & Ian, England.

Reviews.Title: “Look for hidden charges, fine print and swapping reserved rooms.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to be charged ridiculous amounts for unspoken rules, be moved to an "upgraded room" that is not what you reserved, or simply stay in a loud hotel where you don't sleep, stay here. We were told we were getting an upgrade and instead were taken down the street to a room that required us to climb 3 sets of very steep stairs with heavy bags. Only after asking for the manager to put us in the room we actually reserved and had checked into only 3 hours before, we were moved back to our original room. We took a water out of the mini bar and after we returned home, we were charged $21 for the water and a service charge for not telling them we took the water. We expected this hotel to be run like any other hotel we stayed in during our European travels and charge us for the water when they check the minibar, not be punished with a hefty fine for not telling them. There is also a restaurant behind the hotel. It is loud when they take out the trash late at night. Just Don't do it.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Private”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was vacation with my wife and our 1yr old daughter, we had reservations with the Best Western just down the street but after our stay there we decided to stay in A-dam for an aditional 3 days, since BW was booked we had to look for a new hotel. We walked down the street to the first place we found and which happened to be the Hotel Amstelzicht. The clerk was very friendly and we ended up checking in to one of their appartment rooms that turned out to be fabulous. For the same price of the crappy BW room we got a room with a huge kingsized bed, a living room with 2 chairs and satelite t.v, a kitchennette including a fridge and a microwave and a coffe maker with coffee and an asortment of tea. The bathroom was the only mediocre thing about this place, it was clean and all but the shower was small and it was just a shower head comming out of the wall with a curtain around it. The location was perfect too, walking distance to everything. This place is just aweome, i wish we could of stayed there the whole time. If this place is good enough for me and my family then its good enough for you! I'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Amstelzicht Hotel via the Internet for a 3 night stay on the way back home after visiting Paris. The hotel was very good, The museums, restaurants and so on were all within easy walking distance. The rooms were more than adequate, clean, cool, new and quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful and in the morning there was free coffee in the lobby. Great to start your day. Would I stay there again, yes if I visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Galina32
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. I was not too imprested, but it was an OK value. The room was very big to the european standards with a sitting area, but the furniture is very old and it was dusty. I wasn't using the wardrobe or any other storage areas, because I felt if I'll touch it, it will fall apart. Bathroom was very clean and nice. Overall it was a good stay, because Amsterdam is a very nice city with a lot of fun to do and see and we did not spend a lot of time in the room at all. Be careful if you're buying it in US, because the prices were listed in both currencies, but we were not charged upfront, and at the checkout when they converted Euros to USD is was much more than advertised. The location of the hotel was good. 20 minutes walk to the Centraal Station and walking distance to all the attractions and museums. We were not using the tram, because it is a lovely city to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Listen To The Bad Reviews - This Place Is Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a total hotel snob and I loved this place. The rooms were very spacious and bathrooms very clean. The people are so nice and incredibly helpful. Small rooms? HARDLY. Our room was HUGE. We stayed in the room facing the canal which was bigger than most NYC apartments. I will definitely stay here every time we travel to Amsterdam. Yes you do have to leave the key -- but you have to all over europe. There is someone there 24 hours a day so it is never an inconvenience. Its like you are staying with family when you stay here. And the people are very hip and knowledgeable of good places to eat and drink in the area. Please take my advice and book this hotel! Oh and thank you to the owners of the hotel who really went out of their way to accomodate us!

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with friends”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlsfriend in Hotel Amstelzicht for queensday (30th april), and we loved it! Beautifull sharming room( number 4) just renovated. Breakfast was plenty. very nice welcome, they offer us coffee by check in. We felt like staying with friends. We will be back. Rick and Sandra

Reviews.Title: “Great place, little gem”
Reviews.Author: fanDublin
Reviews.Content: This is a great find. I checked out many, many hotels on the internet before making a booking and was glad I did my homework. It's central to absolutely everything, the rooms are lovely and the staff are friendly. Ask for room number one, it's huge and has two chandelers and its on the ground floor so there are no steep stairs to negotiate after a few drinks. If your going to Amsterdam you should definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the Plague”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have traveled to Amsterdam over 10 times and never stayed in anywhere so TERRIBLE. The rooms were tiny (2 beds in 1 room and 3 in another). The bed was for someone aged 5 or under and the views of a concrete wall were awful. After checking out i was told i had to clean my own room which i did and then 1 week later was charged and extra 150 euros for what i don't know. I'm persuing legal action so avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for fun times - Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for me and two friends for a Xmas vacation getaway. Before we were even in the room they began with RULES! No smoking (Ok we heard him and granted thier request begrudgingly) ALWAYS LEAVE KEY (didn't make me happy to leave the key to my room) We unpacked and settled what we had. We decided to go out and hit a coffee shop. We returned about 2 hours later - walked in room and there was a huge stand alone air purifier and the windows all were open in the room (our room had a giant picture with windows that butted up against an alley way) I asked why was our room entered he advised me that we were not to smoke in the room. I kindly advised him that no one smoked in the room (maybe our clothes smelled) and that the window is open and between the 3 of us had valuables in the room. I told him that I wanted to speak with Managment. Basically this place is horribly ran by someone who doesn't have a CLUE what even a little bit of customer service is. Bottom line is the entire time I felt unwelcommed and had a feeling like I was staying in a prison to a degree having to check with them every move made. OH THE ALLEY WAY THE HOTEL BACK UP TO EMPTIES THEIR EMPTY BOTTLES EARLY AND IS EXTREMELY LOUD DUMPING THEM INTO VARIOUS BINS!!! NO FUN TO BE HAD AT AMSTELZICHT. Location is good that was it. Visited Amsterdam many times and stayed various places throughout the city and this was the most unpleasant one, by far.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Amstelzicht
HotelInfo.Address: Amstel 104, Amsterdam 1017 AD, The Netherlands
